common_part.cm4_title: Developmental trajectories of neuroanatomical alterations associated with the 16p11.2 Copy Number Variations

cm6_clarity_of_research_objectives.reason: The abstract explicitly states the aim to characterize age-related effects of 16p11.2 CNVs using a large normative developmental dataset to adjust for age, and clarifies the application purpose of a normative developmental model to quantify deviations across development.
cm6_clarity_of_research_objectives.supporting_text: In this study, we aim at characterizing age-related effects of 16p11.2 copy number variants by analyzing a group with a broad age range including younger individuals. A large normative developmental dataset was used to accurately adjust for effects of age.

common_part.cm7_additional_comments: Normative modeling leverages NIHPD (1.5T) to normalize a 3T multi-site 16p11.2 dataset; analyses include region-level volumes and voxel-wise TBM Z-scores with multiple-comparison control (Bonferroni, FDR).

nm1_clear_definition_of_target_populatio.reason: The study clearly defines CNV carriers (16p11.2 BP4-5 deletions and duplications) and controls, provides sample sizes, age ranges, and sex distribution. Diagnostic categories are detailed with DSM-5 reference in the supplement.
nm1_clear_definition_of_target_populatio.supporting_text: This included 56 16p11.2 BP4-5 deletion carriers (DEL)… 19 duplication carriers (DUP)… and 105 controls (CTRL)… Demographics, age distribution and neuropsychiatric diagnoses are detailed in Table 1… From the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, DSM-5…
nm1_clear_definition_of_target_populatio.location: CardenasDeLaParra2019.pdf.md: 2.1.1 Participants / 16p11.2 CNVs cohort; 1-s2.0-S1053811919307463-mmc1.docx.md: Supplementary Table 1

nm2_clarity_of_inclusion_and_exclusion_c.reason: Inclusion criteria include age range (4.5–23 years) and group definitions; quality control via visual motion check is described and final N per group is reported. However, uniform application details and explicit exclusion reasons beyond QC are not fully specified.
nm2_clarity_of_inclusion_and_exclusion_c.supporting_text: In order to be able to normalize with NIHPD data, we only included participants between 4.5 and 23 years of age… We performed a thorough visual quality control check looking for evidence of motion artefacts. … This included 56 … 19 … and 105 …

nm3_handling_of_confounding_variables.reason: Age and sex are explicitly modeled in the normative NIHPD dataset using mixed-effects with linear and quadratic age terms and a sex effect. Protocol differences (multi- vs single-echo) are adjusted via a linear model, and prior analyses address site/scanner effects.
nm3_handling_of_confounding_variables.supporting_text: Mixed-effect models were used… we included both linear and quadratic effects of age… Linear effect of sex was also included… Raw values of each metrics are corrected for age and protocol (i.e. single echo vs multi echo scans) through a linear model… Extensive analyses on the potential effect of these scanning sites and protocols were performed… none of the regions… could be attributed to artefacts introduced by the multisite analyses.
nm3_handling_of_confounding_variables.location: CardenasDeLaParra2019.pdf.md: 2.4.1 Z-scoring / Model; Figure 1 caption; 2.2 MRI protocol (site effects reference)

nm4_clarity_of_data_sources.reason: Data sources are clearly described: 16p11.2 cohorts from European Consortium and Simons VIP, and normative NIHPD Objective 1 dataset with sample counts and scanning schedule.
nm4_clarity_of_data_sources.supporting_text: Cross-sectional data was acquired in 2 different cohorts (the European -EU 16p11.2 consortium and the Simons VIP -SVIP study in North America)… As normative reference data for brain growth, we used the multi-site longitudinal data… of the publicly available NIHPD project… 339 children… scanned longitudinally at 2 or 3 time points…
nm4_clarity_of_data_sources.location: CardenasDeLaParra2019.pdf.md: 2.1.1 16p11.2 CNVs cohort; 2.1.2 General population - NIHPD cohort

nm5_description_of_image_acquisition_pro.reason: Acquisition protocols for the 16p11.2 dataset (3T scanners, MPRAGE/ME-MPRAGE, slice thickness) are described in the main text, with detailed parameters (TR/TE/flip/FOV) provided in Supplementary Table 2. NIHPD acquisition parameters are also summarized.
nm5_description_of_image_acquisition_pro.supporting_text: The MRI data from the 16p11.2 individuals included T1-weighted… at 7 sites using different 3T scanners… 3D T1w MPRAGE with 1-mm-thick sagittal slices… Details… in Supplementary Table 2. … Scans of the NIHPD controls were obtained at 6 study centers with 1.5 Tesla… TR 22-25 msec, TE 10-11 msec… Flip angle 30°…

nm6_details_of_data_preprocessing.reason: Preprocessing steps are detailed including denoising, N3 bias correction, histogram-based intensity normalization, linear and nonlinear registrations, brain extraction (BEaST), and TBM Jacobian computation with smoothing; tools and algorithms are cited.
nm6_details_of_data_preprocessing.supporting_text: The preprocessing steps… (1) denoising, (2) intensity inhomogeneity correction using the N3 algorithm… (3) intensity normalization by histogram matching… Brain extraction… using… BEaST… Subsequently, images were non-linearly registered using… ANIMAL… TBM uses the deformation fields… A 3D Gaussian filter with FWHM of 10 mm… The Jacobian determinant… log-transformed…

nm7_clarity_of_data_partitioning_methods.reason: The study does not describe partitioning into training/validation/test sets nor cross-validation for the normative modeling; analyses are based on mixed-effects modeling of NIHPD and application of Z-scoring to the cross-sectional 16p11.2 dataset.
nm7_clarity_of_data_partitioning_methods.supporting_text: Mixed-effect models were used… individual profiles suggest modeling brain growth as a quadratic function over time… Age… continuous… sex included… [No mention of data splits or cross-validation in Methods sections].
nm7_clarity_of_data_partitioning_methods.location: CardenasDeLaParra2019.pdf.md: 2.4.1 Z-scoring for age and gender; Methods

nm8_details_of_normative_modeling_approa.reason: Normative developmental trajectories are modeled via mixed-effects in NIHPD with linear and quadratic age terms and sex; voxel-wise TBM Jacobians are Z-scored relative to the normative model. Methods and references are provided.
nm8_details_of_normative_modeling_approa.supporting_text: To compute Z-scores… we modeled the effect of… age and gender in the NIHPD normative dataset. Mixed-effect models were used… we included both linear and quadratic effects of age… Linear effect of sex was also included… This normalizing method extended to whole-brain voxel-level data, where all Jacobian determinants… were used as a surrogate metric of relative local tissue volume.

nm9_details_of_training_algorithm.reason: No optimization or training procedures (e.g., algorithm choice, hyperparameter tuning, convergence criteria) are described for the normative model beyond specifying the mixed-effects formulation.
nm9_details_of_training_algorithm.supporting_text: [No description of optimization algorithms, hyperparameter search, or convergence criteria in Methods 2.4.1 or elsewhere.]

nm10_model_performance_evaluation_metric.reason: The paper reports statistical significance for group differences (Bonferroni/FDR) but does not report model performance metrics for the normative model (e.g., MSLL, correlation, R²) or uncertainty intervals for model fit.
nm10_model_performance_evaluation_metric.supporting_text: P-values are corrected with Bonferroni correction for 8 simultaneous comparisons… Only regions with a FDR correction (q < 0.05) are presented. [No model performance metrics are provided.]

nm11_implementation_of_internal_validati.reason: There is no description of internal validation procedures such as held-out validation sets or cross-validation for the normative modeling.
nm11_implementation_of_internal_validati.supporting_text: [No internal validation (e.g., K-fold or holdout) described.]

nm12_external_data_validation.reason: The study does not evaluate the normative model on independent external datasets beyond NIHPD (normative) and the study's 16p11.2 cohort.
nm12_external_data_validation.supporting_text: [No external validation dataset usage beyond NIHPD normative modeling and the 16p11.2 cohort application.]

nm13_description_of_dataset_characterist.reason: Sample sizes, age ranges, and sex distributions are reported for groups (DEL/CTRL/DUP), and ancestry composition is described. However, there are no partitions (train/validation/test) and missing data handling is not described.
nm13_description_of_dataset_characterist.supporting_text: Table 1… N, Age range, Sex (M/F)… The NIHPD and the 16p11.2 cohorts show similar proportions in ancestry composition…
nm13_description_of_dataset_characterist.location: CardenasDeLaParra2019.pdf.md: Table 1 (2.2 MRI protocol context); 2.1.2 NIHPD cohort

nm14_consideration_for_reproducibility.reason: Data availability is mentioned (Simons VIP via SFARI Base; supplementary data online; NIHPD public dataset). Software tools are cited but versions and full code availability are not provided; trained models are not shared.
nm14_consideration_for_reproducibility.supporting_text: Approved researchers can obtain the Simons VIP population dataset… by applying at https://base.sfari.org. … Supplementary data to this article can be found online at https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuroimage.2019.116155. … The NIH MRI study of normal brain development… publicly available NIHPD project…
nm14_consideration_for_reproducibility.location: CardenasDeLaParra2019.pdf.md: Acknowledgments; Appendix A; 2.1.2 NIHPD cohort

nm15_interpretation_specific_to_normativ.reason: The paper interprets individual-level deviation (Z-scores) patterns across regions (e.g., insula, calcarine) and emphasizes stability from 4.5 to 23 years, but does not define clinical thresholds or decision criteria. It notes advantages over small control groups and prospects for application.
nm15_interpretation_specific_to_normativ.supporting_text: Thanks to a continuous voxel-wise model of normative developmental trajectory, we show that 16p11.2 CNV carriers have brain alterations present already at 4.5 years… stable across childhood, adolescence and early adulthood… The major contribution… is the use of a model to normalize the non-linear effect of age during typical brain development…
nm15_interpretation_specific_to_normativ.location: CardenasDeLaParra2019.pdf.md: Conclusion; 4.1 Continuous model of normative developmental trajectory

cr1_clear_definition_of_target_populatio.reason: Target populations (16p11.2 deletion/duplication carriers and controls) are clearly defined with sample sizes, age ranges, and sex; DSM-5 diagnostic categories provided.
cr1_clear_definition_of_target_populatio.supporting_text: This included 56 … deletion carriers… 19 duplication carriers… and 105 controls… Demographics, age distribution and neuropsychiatric diagnoses are detailed in Table 1… From the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, DSM-5…

cr2_clarity_of_inclusion_and_exclusion_c.reason: Inclusion age range and group selection are specified; QC for motion is described; final sample sizes reported. However, exclusion reasons and uniform application across sites are not comprehensively detailed.
cr2_clarity_of_inclusion_and_exclusion_c.supporting_text: we only included participants between 4.5 and 23 years of age… The controls were recruited among non-carriers first-degree relatives… or volunteers… We performed a thorough visual quality control check…

cr3_clarity_of_data_sources.reason: Data sources (EU 16p11.2 consortium, Simons VIP, NIHPD) are clearly named and described.
cr3_clarity_of_data_sources.supporting_text: Cross-sectional data was acquired in 2 different cohorts (the European -EU 16p11.2 consortium and the Simons VIP -SVIP study in North America)… As normative reference data… NIHPD project…

cr4_description_of_image_acquisition_pro.reason: Acquisition details for 16p11.2 cohort (scanner models, sequences, slice thickness) are provided, and detailed parameters are listed in the supplement; NIHPD acquisition parameters are summarized.
cr4_description_of_image_acquisition_pro.supporting_text: … 3T scanners: Philips Achieva, Siemens Prisma Syngo and Siemens Tim Trio… 3D T1w … MPRAGE with 1-mm-thick sagittal slices… Details… in Supplementary Table 2… Scans of the NIHPD controls… 1.5 Tesla… TR 22-25 msec, TE 10-11 msec…

cr5_details_of_data_preprocessing.reason: The preprocessing pipeline and QC are clearly described, including bias correction, normalization, registration, brain extraction, and TBM derivation with referenced tools.
cr5_details_of_data_preprocessing.supporting_text: The preprocessing steps… denoising… N3 algorithm… histogram matching… linear registration… Brain extraction… BEaST… non-linearly registered… ANIMAL… TBM… Gaussian filter… log-transformed Jacobian…

cr6_validity_of_outcome_measures.reason: Outcomes (global volumes, TBM Jacobian-based local volumes) are defined and standard, with QC described and multiple-comparison control applied. However, formal reliability metrics (e.g., ICC) and assessor blinding are not reported.
cr6_validity_of_outcome_measures.supporting_text: We normalized volumes of segmented brain regions as well as volumes of each voxel defined by tensor-based morphometry… We performed a thorough visual quality control check… P-values are corrected with Bonferroni… Only regions with a FDR correction (q < 0.05) are presented.
cr6_validity_of_outcome_measures.location: CardenasDeLaParra2019.pdf.md: Abstract; 2.1 Participants; Figure captions (Fig. 1, Fig. 2)

cr7_handling_of_confounding_variables.reason: Key confounders (age, sex) are modeled in NIHPD; protocol differences (multi vs single echo) are adjusted; site/scanner effects have been previously assessed with no artefactual findings attributed to multisite acquisition.
cr7_handling_of_confounding_variables.supporting_text: Mixed-effect models were used… linear and quadratic effects of age… Linear effect of sex… Raw values… corrected for age and protocol… Extensive analyses on the potential effect of these scanning sites and protocols were performed… none… attributed to artefacts…
cr7_handling_of_confounding_variables.location: CardenasDeLaParra2019.pdf.md: 2.4.1 Z-scoring; Fig. 1 caption; 2.2 MRI protocol (site effects reference)
